intro: Manulea violacea, commonly known as the violet manulea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and has simple, opposite leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
